scenario_text.value: I wonder where all these kids will go now.
Worried about their new home?

Yeah. I wonder if they’ll stay here or try
and find somewhere else.

(Hmm, I feel like she’s worrying too much.
They live in this world, after all.)

(Still, maybe I should stick with her until
she feels better, instead of saying as much.)

(I think it’d be best to take them all to the
school, but...)
(What should I say to her?)
You think too much.
Want to stay longer?
Take care of them.

I wouldn’t overthink it if I were you. This
is where they were born and raised, right?

I’m sure they’ll find some other place to
live and settle into a new life soon.

Hey, Aoi’s not stupid. She knows that as well
as you do. She’s just worried.
Oh. Okay, then.

(Still, there isn’t much we can do right now.
We have to head to the shrine soon.)

Hey Aoi, if you’re worried why don’t we stick
around here a bit longer?

Yes, let’s do that. I want to stay with them
as long as we can.

I wish we could stay with them until they
found a new home.
Only we don’t have that kind of time.
I know...

It’d be best if we could take them all back
to the school...

Oh, not a bad idea! It’s a big area, with
plenty to eat!

No, I see the appeal but that’d be a bit
difficult.
Difficult? Why’s that?

There’s no safe path to the school from here.
Besides, we need to head to the shrine.

We don’t even know if the school is safe. The
Kenzoku attacked when we were there, right?
Oh, that’s true...
Are you worried about this place too, Takuma?

So you noticed... Sorry, I wish I had
a better idea.

Oh no, I’m just happy you’re trying to cheer
me up.

(Aoi looks a bit better, I think? That’s
good...)

Plus, they’ve got Jijimon. They’ll be fine.
The best we can do right now is trust them.
You’re right. I’ll choose to believe in them.

Someone should tell them how you feel, Aoi!
I’ll be right back!
Labramon, wait! That’s really not necessary!
...And she’s gone.

Well, she’s only got your best interests at
heart. I wouldn’t be too upset if I were you.

Yeah, I know. I guess I’d better head after
her.
(This must be Aoi’s way of saying goodbye.)

There’s not much I can do for these kids.
Still, I’ll do whatever I can.
